intro: Stigmaphyllon digitatum, commonly known as the featherleaf stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within dense tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest for botanical conservation efforts.
